sen.j: 玉城 織衛（たまき おりえ）は、豊後国（現 大分県）出身の幕末の直心影流剣術の剣客。
sen.e: Orie TAMAKI,from Bungo Province (present Oita prefecture), was an expert swordsman of swordplay in Jikishinkage-ryu style in the end of Edo period.
Orie TAMAKI,from Bungo Province (present Oita Prefecture), was an expert swordsman of swordplay in Jikishinkage-ryu style in the end of Edo period.
sen.cmt: prefectureの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Orie TAMAKI,from Bungo Province (present Oita Prefecture), was an expert swordsman of swordplay in Jikishinkage-ryu style in the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 新徴組の剣術教授方の一人で、剣の腕では新徴組随一と謳われた。
sen.e: He was one of the Teacher of swordsmanship in Shinchogumi (Tokugawa Shogunate guard organization) and famed for the greatest swordcraft in Shinchogumi.
He was one of the Teacher of Swordsmanship in Shinchogumi (Tokugawa shogunate guard organization) and famed for the greatest swordcraft in Shinchogumi.
sen.cmt: the Teacher of Swordsmanshipとし、Shogunateの頭文字を小文字に変更
sen.e: He was one of the Teacher of Swordsmanship in Shinchogumi (Tokugawa shogunate guard organization) and famed for the greatest swordcraft in Shinchogumi.

sen.j: 剣術修行のため江戸に出て、男谷信友の道場に入門して修行した。
sen.e: He went to Edo for swordplay training, then he entered Nobutomo ODANI dojo training hall to receive training,
He went to Edo for swordplay training, then he entered Nobutomo ODANI dojo training hall to receive training.
sen.cmt: カンマ→ピリオドに修正
sen.e: He went to Edo for swordplay training, then he entered Nobutomo ODANI dojo training hall to receive training.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）の浪士組結成の際、浪士組に加わった。
sen.e: In 1863, at the time of the formation of roshi-gumi (an organization of masterless samurai), he joined roshi-gumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1863, at the time of the formation of roshi-gumi (an organization of masterless samurai), he joined roshi-gumi.
In 1863, at the time of the formation of roshi-gumi (an organization of masterless samurai), he joined roshi-gumi.

sen.j: 浪士組五番隊に属して上洛したが、上洛後の浪士組分裂により清河八郎らとともに江戸に戻った。
sen.e: Although he went up to Kyoto as a member of roshi-gumi gobantai (No.5 troop), he returned to Edo with Hachiro KIYOKAWA and other member, because of division of roshi-gumi after their going up to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although he went up to Kyoto as a member of roshi-gumi gobantai (No.5 troop), he returned to Edo with Hachiro KIYOKAWA and other member, because of division of roshi-gumi after their going up to Kyoto.

Although he went up to Kyoto as a member of roshi-gumi gobantai (No.5 troop), he returned to Edo with Hachiro KIYOKAWA and other member, because of division of roshi-gumi after their going up to Kyoto.

sen.j: 同年、江戸に戻った浪士組が新徴組に改組され、玉城は剣術教授方の一人に選ばれた。
sen.e: In the same year, roshi-gumi was reorganized into Shinchogumi after returning to Edo, and TAMAKI was selected for one of the Teacher of swordsmanship.
In the same year, roshi-gumi was reorganized into Shinchogumi after returning to Edo, and Tamaki was selected for one of the Teacher of Swordsmanship.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、TAMAKI→Tamaki、the Teacher of Swordsmanshipとしました。
sen.e: In the same year, roshi-gumi was reorganized into Shinchogumi after returning to Edo, and Tamaki was selected for one of the Teacher of Swordsmanship.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では、新徴組は庄内藩兵とともに戦ったが、敗戦後、玉城を含む新徴組隊士は劣悪な条件で開墾に徴用された。
sen.e: In Boshin War, Shinchogumi fought together with samurai of the Shonai clan, however, after defeat in the war, members of Shinchogumi including TAMAKI were recruited for cultivation under poor condition.

In Boshin War, Shinchogumi fought together with samurai of the Shonai clan, however, after defeat in the war, members of Shinchogumi including TAMAKI were recruited for cultivation under poor condition.

In Boshin War, Shinchogumi fought together with samurai of the Shonai clan, however, after defeat in the war, members of Shinchogumi including TAMAKI were recruited for cultivation under poor condition.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）、玉城の指揮により新徴組元隊士80名とともに脱走。
sen.e: In 1872, under the direction of TAMAKI, he escaped from there with 80 members of Shinchogumi.
In 1872, under the direction of Tamaki, he escaped from there with 80 members of Shinchogumi.
In 1872, under the direction of Tamaki, he escaped from there with 80 members of Shinchogumi.

sen.j: その後の消息は不明である。
sen.e: After that, they were never heard from again.
After that, they were never heard from again.
After that, they were never heard from again.
